sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The cos function is used to find the cosine of an angle given in radians. For example, cos (0) is 1.
sections.mdown_content: The **cos** function is used to find the cosine of an angle given in radians. For example, **cos** (0) is 1.

sections.title: Example
code:
const pi := 3.14159
        for i : 1 .. 12
            const angle := i * pi / 6
            put "Cos of ", angle, " is ", cos (angle)
        end for
sections.raw_content: This program prints out the cosine of p/6, 2p/6, 3p/6, up to 12p/6 radians.
sections.mdown_content: This program prints out the cosine of p/6, 2p/6, 3p/6, up to 12p/6 radians.

sections.title: See also
sections.raw_content:
the sin and tan functions for calculating sine and tangent.

the cosd function which finds the cosine of an angle given in degrees. (2p radians are the same as 360 degrees.)

See also predefined unit Math.
sections.mdown_content:
the **[sin.html](sin)** and **[tan.html](tan)** functions for calculating sine and tangent.
the **[cosd.html](cosd)** function which finds the cosine of an angle given in degrees. (2p radians are the same as 360 degrees.)

See also predefined unit **[mathmodule.html](Math)**.
